job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) in Lowell, MA
pros: Always well stocked, knowledgable staff, no expense spared for great care. Scholarships, good pay, open door policy with nursing supervisors
cons: Do not hire within, aren't fair with splitting up hours for per diem staff, sometimes unrelaistic standards out upon staff

Management doesn’t care for employee needs or give much flexibility
Always short staffed in every department

review_title: Not What it Looks Like on the Surface
job_title: Cold Food Prep Worker/Salad Bar in Bedford, MA
pros: Enjoyed working in a community of elderly that deserved top quality care
cons:
HIred to work Tuesday - Saturday with Sunday and Monday off, BUT told I had to temporarily change my schedule while someone was on leave and my days off were Wednesday and Thursday, but my scheduled NEVER changed when this employee returned.  I also had to work every holiday.  Asked about it several times and just received shrug shoulder responses.

Suffered a work related injury  - fell with plenty of medical documentation, xrays and more to support my injury, and was on Worker's Compensation and my job was immediately posted and filled within one week of medical leave.  Supervisor was rude, and unprofessional during the entire process.  HR did nothing to help.

I reported my problem to the CEO and received no response.

pros: Clean, well stocked, decent pay, safe
cons: Nothing ever changes, behind in technology, no room for growth

review_title: Staff Nurse at Carleton Willard Village
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Charge Nurse in Bedford, MA
cons: Unwanted overtime due to short staff

review_title: Victim  workplace violence and bullying by management
cons: Nursing management hides EVERYTHING from CEO and Administration. Physically assaulted by co worker more than once. No support from HR.  Retaliated against for reporting abuse by nursing management.

pros: They serve lunch on weekdays - free to kitchen employees
